dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3667596A] Copyrighted material on your site
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringement%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, March 28, 2007 12:51 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3667596A] Copyrighted material on your site

==== Forwarded Ticket ====

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 28 Mar 2007 22:49:45.0103 (UTC) FILETIME=[615A01F0:01C7718B] 

 (multipart/alternative) 
MIME element (text/plain) 
Hello, 
 
It's been brought to my attention that one of our stories is being   
republished, without permission and in violation of copyright, on   
your web site, www.evesgarden.org. Furthermore, I've been advised by   
the story's author that she has notified you of that fact and you   
have declined to remove the story from your site. (See Correspondence   
below.) 
 
The story is titled "The Dirt on Green Cleaning" and can be found, on   
your site, at the following URL: 
http://www.evesgarden.org/archives/2007/03/23/The_Dirt_on_Green_Cleaning 
 
The story was originally published in our newspaper and on our web   
site on March 13, 2007, and can be found on our web site here: 
http://www.portlandtribune.com/sustainable/story.php?  
story_id=117346634558825000 
 
I am requesting that you: 
1) Remove this story from your web site immediately 
2) Remove any other of our stories you may have republished on your   
web site 
3) Refrain from republishing any of our stories on your web site 
 
If you fail to comply with this request, a DMCA take down request   
will submitted to your ISP to ensure that the copyrighted material is   
removed. 
 
With regard to the reference in your email (Correspondence, below) to   
"Title 17 U.S.C. Section 107," Section 107, commonly referred to as   
the "Fair Use doctrine," allows the reproduction limited portions of   
copyrighted work for research and educational purposes but in no way   
allows republication of copyrighted works in their entirety. This is   
explained on the U.S. Copyright Office web site, http://  
www.copyright.gov/fls/fl102.html (emphasis mine): 
 
 
 
The distinction between
